title: Restaurant Branding - Reap
statement: Designed a restaurant brand identity from conception to execution, including restaurant framework (food type, audience, location), logo, several visual assets, and presented the final work.
tools: Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, Premiere Pro

title: Editorial Design - Intertwine Magazine
statement: Designed a magazine from conception to execution, including masthead, visual elements, cover, table of contents, feature article, and overarching style guide. Researched audience, competition, and market fit. Mocked up print visuals, and made a final presentation of the magazine design process and final product.
tools: Abode Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, Premiere Pro

title: Website Recreation & Style Guide - Set Margins Publications
statement: Tasked with recreating the visual layout of a website of my choice, using HTML for structure and responsive CSS (with Flexbox and Grid) for styling. I chose Set Margins Publications website, a publisher of design books in the Netherlands. Got really close to the real thing, minus a few tiny little details.

title: p5.js Parameter Examples
statement: Created three iterations visualizing the concept/use of parameters in the p5.js library. Worked with color, shape, size, scale, animation, and relationship to create compelling web graphics.

title: p5.js Iteration Example
statement: Using the p5.js library, created an animated web graphic illustrating the concept of iteration, working with color, shape, size, and scale to create a visually compelling graphic.

title: p5.js Natural Emulation Example
statement: Using the p5.js library, created an example of natural emulation, snow tumbling down a slight incline, or wind flows in an enclosed space.

title: p5.js Oscillation Example
statement: Using the p5.js library, created an example of oscillation using sine math.

title: Expressive Type Mural
statement: Using a word of my choice, created an expressive type mural that signifies the meaning of the word through typeface choice, color, layout, orientation, and hierarchy.

title: Typographic Heirarchy Poster - Film Festival
statement: Using only typography, created a poster for a fictional film festival. Considered typeface choice, scale, hierarchy, orientation, color, contrast, readability, and intended audience.

title: Typographic Forms Exercise
statement: Tasked with using type expressively in a 3x3 grid in only black & white, I worked with typeface, glyphs, orientation, scale, and relationship to create a dynamic mural through type.
